title: About 1,250 more irrigation tanks in T.N. reach full level after Cyclone Ditwah
content: On November 24, the number of tanks that had attained 100% capacity was 2,614. On December 4, it was 3,865, according to a comparison of the storage position of tanks for the two days

title: People of Madurai want development politics, not other kinds of politics: T.N. CM Stalin
content: In light of the Tirpparankundram row in Madurai, the CM asked in a social media post whether the city needed development politics or some other kind of politics

title: AIG Poonguzhali to supervise probe in second rape case against Kerala MLA Rahul Mamkootathil
content: Officials say the move assumes significance against the backdrop of possibility of more comparable ‘me-too’ disclosures surfacing in public domain against Mamkootathil. They note that Poonguzhali has considerable experience as nodal officer for victims who testified before Justice Hema Committee

title: Make SIR data public, stop pressure on BLOs: Akhilesh Yadav
content: Mr. Yadav alleged that attempts were being made to delete names of people belonging to Pichhda, Dalit, Alpasankhyak communities in various assembly constituencies

title: Congress leadership tussle: Who will lead Karnataka after 2025?
content: The internal faultlines between the Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah and Deputy Chief Minister D.K. Shivakumar camps have become all but apparent.

title: Civic official arrested in Virar building collapse that killed 17
content: Assistant Comissioner Gonsalves, who was in charge of ward C, failed to take action under the Maharashtra Regional and Town Planning (MRTP) Act, 1966, despite a structural audit flagging the building as dangerous and unauthorised

title: Three militants arrested in Manipur for threatening Sangai festival participants
content: “Five cases were registered in connection with the alleged threats by the proscribed G-5 to those who had attended the Sangai festival,” a senior officer said

title: Singapore High Commissioner among stranded passengers amid IndiGo's flight chaos
content: In a post on X, the official handle of Singapore HC in India, wrote that his flight to the Jharkhand town was cancelled unexpectedly, leaving him unable to attend the wedding of a young staff member

title: Watch: UN Security Council delegation visits Syria for first time since 1945
content: The UN Security Council visited Syria for the first time since 1945, signalling the country’s renewed global engagement under its new government.

title: White collar terror module: SIA raids in Srinagar, Ganderbal
content: Raids were carried out in Tufail Bhat’s residence, who was arrested by the SIA last month in connection with the "white collar" terror module case

title: Saffron shawl and hijab row resurfaces in Haveri district of Karnataka
content: The saffron shwal-hijab row resurfaced in Karnataka with some students wearing a saffron shawl after a few students started wearing hijab to class in C.G. Bellad Government First Grade College at Akki Alur of Haveri district

title: Canadian national held at Indo-Nepal border for using fake immigration stamp
content: Immigration and police officials said a fake stamp of the Delhi Airport Immigration Office was found on his passport

title: Adults can be in live-in relationship even without attaining marriageable age: Rajasthan HC
content: The court says the right to life and personal liberty under Article 21 of the Constitution cannot be denied merely because the petitioners are not of marriageable age

title: Chaos deepens at RGIA as 92 IndiGo flights cancelled on December 5, three-day count reaches 197
content: RGIA police deployed additional personnel at the IndiGo enquiry counters to manage agitated passengers and prevent further disorder

title: Karnataka High Court sets aside third round provisional allotment list for MBBS and BDS courses, directs KEA to undertake process afresh
content: A three-judge bench delivered the unanimous verdict after the petitions were referred to the HC following the divergent judgment passed by a division bench on November 19

title: Major traffic restrictions in Delhi amid Putin's visit
content: Mr. Putin is expected to make diplomatic visits to Rajghat, Bharat Mandapam, Hyderabad House and Rashtrapati Bhavan among other places as part of his engagements

title: IndiGo flight disruptions persist, stranding hundreds at Kerala airports
content: IndiGo has cancelled two inbound flights to Thiruvananthapuram from Pune and Bengaluru, and six flights, including arrivals and departures, remain delayed for hours on Friday

title: IndiGo flight cancellations stretch into fourth straight day; airline’s departures from Delhi on hold till midnight
content: At least 102 IndiGo flights were cancelled early at Bengaluru’s Kempegowda International Airport (KIA)

title: Goa | Serendipity’s decade shift, and what to expect at the arts festival this year
content: 10 years later, Goa’s most ambitious arts gathering that has seen over 3,500 artists, has become a movement

title: Simone Tata, mother of Noel Tata, passes away at the age of 95
content: Simone Tata was the second  wife of Naval Tata and her only son Noel Tata is currently the chairman of Tata Trusts and chairman of three Tata Group companies

title: Electric bike maker Ultraviolette raises $45 mn from Lingotto, Zoho to fund market expansion
content: Ultraviolette will use this capital to accelerate its domestic and international scale-up of current products F77 and X-47, and future product platforms Shockwave and Tesseract

title: CEO tells West Bengal BLOs to re-verify forms, delete dead or absent voters by December 11
content: In his note, the CEO reminded BLOs that they are on deputation to the ECI for the SIR exercise and are responsible for crucial verification work

title: Cyclone Ditwah: Indian Envoy discusses reconstruction needs with Sri Lanka’s Housing Minister
content: Santosh Jha's meeting with Susil Ranasinghe took place as Sri Lanka is grappling with widespread flooding, landslides and severe infrastructure collapse triggered by Cyclone Ditwah

title: Kerala local body polls: Shifting urban currents pose challenge to LDF’s dominance in Thiruvananthapuram
content: The LDF has a comfortable majority in the Corporation, but in many wards it was a neck and neck fight; of the four municipalities, three are likely to witness three-cornered contests; in the rural belt, both UDF and NDA have intensified campaigns around development lapses and local issues

title: Kerala local body polls 2025: With MLA Rahul Mamkootathil’s expulsion, Congress seeks to reshape campaign dynamics
content: In an attempt to contain the political damage caused to the party’s poll prospects, the Congress has expelled the Palakkad MLA, who is facing allegations of rape, coerced termination of pregnancy, from the organisation

title: Telangana’s ₹5 lakh crore land gamble: growth or giveaway?
content: The Hyderabad Industrial Land Transformation Policy seeks to repurpose over 9,000 acres of high-value industrial land for residential, commercial and tech hubs. While the government pitches it as a growth/ revenue booster, Opposition parties cite valuation anomalies and allege the move favours private interests. M. Rajeev examines whether it is Telangana’s next economic leap or a potential giveaway masked as urban development

title: SIR in Gujarat: More than 17 lakh deceased voters found on electoral rolls
content: Dang district is at the forefront in this work with 94.35% digitisation of the counting forms, said the release

title: SEBI bars financial advisor Avadhut Sathe from securities market; orders impounding of ₹546 crore
content: The noticees falsely claimed their course participants/investors achieved extraordinary market returns, misleading prospective course participants with exaggerated profitability claims

title: How the Mahad satyagraha(s) shaped constitutional discourse
content: Mahad marks the birthplace of one of India’s first human rights movements initiated by Dr. B. R. Ambedkar in 1927, challenging caste discrimination and asserting Dalit rights. It also shaped the idea of India and the ethics of its Constitution

title: 102 IndiGo flights cancelled at Bengaluru airport as disruptions continue for fourth day in row
content: IndiGo airlines informed the DGCA that delays and cancellations will continue for the next two to three days

title: Watch: Rasgulla shortage sparks massive brawl at Bihar wedding
content: In Bodh Gaya, a wedding celebration took an unexpected turn when a lack of rasgullas ignited a fierce altercation between the families. The groom's relatives argue that the dessert shortage was the trigger for the uproar, while the bride's family insists that unresolved dowry negotiations were the real cause, leading to injuries and a stalled ceremony.

title: Ashwin decodes Kohli's fiery celebrations; says he is out to prove a point
content: Former India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin believes Virat Kohli is playing with a point to prove after taking whispers about his future to heart. Kohli's animated celebrations and agreement to play the Vijay Hazare Trophy suggest a fierce self-assertion, as he demonstrates renewed technique and ruthless intent, silencing doubts with back-to-back centuries.

title: Public WiFi risks: Cyber experts warn internet users — Here's how to keep your data safe from hackers
content: Public Wi-Fi in cafes and airports offers convenience but poses significant risks. Hackers exploit these open networks to steal data and credentials. Individuals are often easy targets. Protecting your laptop with a VPN and secure browsing habits is crucial. Avoid sensitive transactions like banking on public networks. Simple precautions can safeguard your personal information from cyber threats.

title: 'Vanished in minutes': Kohli fever sells out Vizag ODI; Kaif's post captures frenzy
content: Virat Kohli's sensational return to form, marked by back-to-back centuries, has ignited a nationwide frenzy, selling out the Visakhapatnam ODI against South Africa.  Sluggish ticket sales were reversed overnight, with fans clamoring to witness the phenomenon.  Even high prices couldn't dampen the demand, showcasing Kohli's immense impact on Indian cricket.

title: 'Blinded Pakistan air's defences': IAF recalls day 3 of 1971 war; shares rare images
content: The Indian Air Force commemorated its pivotal role on December 5, 1971, the third day of the war. IAF operations crippled Pakistan's western defenses and devastated enemy airfields. In the east, air superiority paved the way for India's rapid advance, leading to Bangladesh's birth. The Battle of Longewala also saw IAF Hunters decisively halt a Pakistani armored thrust, securing Jaisalmer.

title: Halo deal drama: When Bill Gates told its maker Steve Jobs can’t have it; We will buy you
content: Microsoft's 2000 acquisition of Bungie Studios, spurred by a 1999 Macworld reveal of Halo with Steve Jobs, transformed the game into Xbox's flagship.  This strategic move secured a vital launch title for the console, rescuing Bungie from financial woes and ultimately birthing a multi-billion dollar franchise that redefined console gaming.

title: 'Forceful exit': Harbhajan sympathises with Virat, Rohit; backs them for 2027 World Cup
content: Harbhajan Singh expressed disappointment over the way Indian legends Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma have been treated amid talk of a forced transition, saying many greats before them were similarly sidelined. He criticised those “who haven’t achieved much” for deciding the duo’s future, while praising Kohli and Rohit for their dominant ODI form and backing them as ideal role models — and contenders for the 2027 ODI World Cup.

title: Candace Owens roasted for 'backing out' of TPUSA's Charlie Kirk livestream challenge
content: Candace Owens is facing criticism for contradicting herself. She publicly offered to debate Turning Point USA (TPUSA) leadership anytime, anywhere. However, when TPUSA scheduled a livestream to address her claims, Owens pushed back on the logistics. Critics accuse her of creating drama rather than accepting the challenge she initiated. The situation has become a test of consistency for the commentator.

title: Bezos' ex-wife makes bold move: Amazon stake sale funds Howard University gift
content: MacKenzie Scott has significantly reduced her Amazon stake, donating billions to diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives. Her recent $80 million gift to Howard University highlights her focus on substantial contributions to DEI and disaster relief causes. Despite these large donations, Scott remains a prominent philanthropist.

title: Meesho IPO day 3: Should you subscribe the issue? Check GMP, price band, rating & more
content: Meesho's IPO is nearing its close, attracting significant investor interest with a 7.97 times oversubscription. The Rs 5,421 crore issue, priced between Rs 105-111, shows strong retail and institutional demand. Analysts are cautiously optimistic, citing growth potential despite current losses, with a potential listing gain of around 44.59%.

title: Bags lost, long queues, passengers stranded: IndiGo's nationwide crisis persists — key developments
content: IndiGo's operational crisis has caused widespread chaos for four days, leading to over 550 flight cancellations and stranding thousands of passengers. The airline attributes the disruption to unforeseen challenges and revised crew duty rules, while the DGCA points to misjudged manpower needs. Operations are expected to stabilize by February 10, 2026.

title: 'Full-blown fiasco': As IndiGo fails to fly, chaos at Bengaluru airport; 102 flights cancelled
content: IndiGo flights faced massive disruptions across India on Thursday. Bengaluru alone saw 52 arrivals and 50 departures cancelled. Passengers experienced long queues and uncertainty. The airline cited pilot shortages and crew duty limits. IndiGo has requested operational exemptions until February 10, 2026, to stabilize operations. Fares on other airlines increased significantly amid the crisis.

title: Kobe Bryant slammed by alleged friend, claims he 'wasn’t a good person'
content: New claims suggest NBA legend Kobe Bryant was not a good person and neglected family and friends. An alleged childhood friend shared disappointment over unmet promises of support. This contrasts with Kobe's documented generosity and mentorship. The allegations have sparked debate online, highlighting the complex nature of his legacy. Kobe's life included both personal challenges and significant positive contributions.

title: Travis Kelce’s bold Europe comments on Taylor Swift spark future rumors
content: Travis Kelce recently spoke about his trip to Lake Como with Taylor Swift. He described the beautiful scenery and the warmth of the local people. Kelce expressed his joy and wonder at the experience, finding a new appreciation for life's pace. George Clooney also joined the conversation, sharing his own fondness for the Italian region.

title: Los Angeles Lakers vs Toronto Raptors regular season game - Full injury report
content: The Lakers and Raptors face significant injury woes as they clash on December 4, 2025. With Luka Doncic and Marcus Smart out for LA, and Jakob Poeltl and RJ Barrett sidelined for Toronto, depth players will be crucial. This game becomes a test of adaptability and which supporting cast can step up.

title: CCTV captures assault: Jeweller stabbed to death during robbery; accused watched 25 ‘tutorials'
content: A shocking daylight robbery turned fatal in Modinagar. A 75-year-old jeweller was brutally stabbed to death by an assailant who threw chilli powder in his face. The attacker was quickly caught by alert locals after a brief chase. The incident highlights concerns over law and order in the area. Police are investigating the motive and have detained the suspect.

title: Why RBI cut repo rate even with low inflation, high growth? Sanjay Malhotra explains
content: The Reserve Bank of India has reduced the repo rate by 25 basis points to 5.25%, citing benign inflation and a resilient economy. Despite a strong GDP growth forecast of 7.3% for the fiscal year, the central bank sees potential softening ahead. This move aims to support growth momentum while maintaining macroeconomic stability.

title: 'Lived reputed life, GBA officials ruined it': Bengaluru techie’s death note
content: A Bengaluru software engineer tragically ended his life, citing harassment by a local family and BBMP officials over alleged building plan violations. A 10-page suicide note details accusations of extortion, with the family allegedly demanding Rs 20 lakh to cease the torment. Police have arrested the couple, with their son being sought.

title: ESA discovers butterfly-shaped crater on Mars showing impact, volcanism and water
content: Mars Express has found a unique butterfly-shaped crater on Mars. This formation resulted from a space rock hitting at a low angle. The impact ejected debris in two lobes, creating wing-like structures. Scientists believe subsurface ice or water may have been involved. The area also shows signs of ancient volcanic activity.

title: Indian economy in a ‘rare Goldilocks period’: Why RBI governor said this
content: The Reserve Bank of India cut its policy repo rate by 25 basis points to 5.25%, while raising the FY26 GDP forecast to 7.3% and lowering inflation to 2%. Governor Sanjay Malhotra announced liquidity measures, citing a "rare Goldilocks period" of benign inflation and strong growth.

title: Putin India visit day-2: Visit to Rajghat, bilateral talks with PM Modi — what’s planned today
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin's packed second day in Delhi includes a ceremonial welcome at Rashtrapati Bhavan and a visit to Rajghat. Prime Minister Modi and Putin will hold crucial bilateral talks at Hyderabad House, focusing on defense deals like S-400s and Su-57s, nuclear energy, and broader cooperation. Several agreements are anticipated.

title: RBI rate cut boosts markets: Nifty50 above 26,000; BSE Sensex gains over 230 points
content: Indian equity benchmarks Nifty50 and BSE Sensex surged today after the RBI, led by Governor Sanjay Malhotra, cut the repo rate by 25 basis points to 5.25%. The economy shows resilience, with GDP growth projected at 7.3%. Despite foreign outflows and a weak rupee, markets are watching the RBI's stance on inflation and liquidity.

title: IND vs SA: 'At the top, he would have scored many 100s' - Steyn's big claim on India batter
content: Dale Steyn lauded KL Rahul's evolution as India's premier ODI finisher, highlighting his ability to accelerate effectively in the death overs. Steyn believes Rahul's adaptability and mastery of his role at No. 5 or 6 are invaluable, suggesting he could be a prolific century-maker if positioned higher in the batting order.

title: 'Was disturbed over health': Bengaluru man strangles paralysed wife; then hangs himself
content: A 65-year-old retired bus driver strangled his paralyzed wife to death before hanging himself in their Bengaluru home on December 2. The man was reportedly distressed by his wife's deteriorating health condition. Their son confirmed his father had previously threatened to commit such an act.

title: Hijab–saffron shawl row: Karnataka students seek dress code; college bans mobiles
content: Tension flared at CG Bellad Govt First Grade College as students donned saffron shawls in protest against peers wearing hijabs. Following a month of demands for a hijab ban, over 50 students wore the saffron attire.

title: 'I have a Rolex too': DK Shivakumar quips at BJP; Rs 43 lakh watch in focus
content: Karnataka Deputy CM DK Shivakumar refuted BJP's claims of undeclared assets, asserting full transparency in his affidavit, including a Rolex watch. He also highlighted the Congress government's women empowerment initiatives. Meanwhile, Union Minister Prahlad Joshi criticized the state government for internal divisions, corruption, and infrastructure issues, while addressing Rahul Gandhi's claims about foreign dignitaries.

title: Ashes: Hayden's daughter celebrates Joe Root century with hilarious jab
content: Joe Root's long-awaited century in Australia, a fluent 135, averted a bizarre promise from Matthew Hayden.  Hayden's daughter, Grace, humorously celebrated Root's milestone, saving her father from a public spectacle.  Root's historic ton, his first Down Under after a decade, brought calm to England's innings and marked a significant career achievement.

title: Vitamin K deficiency can damage liver and bones; cause HDN in newborns - check signs
content: Vitamin K is crucial for preventing bleeding and ensuring strong bones. Insufficient levels can cause serious health problems, including bleeding disorders and bone weakness. Adults and newborns face risks of deficiency due to diet, medication, or medical conditions. Maintaining adequate vitamin K intake through diet is essential for overall health and well-being.

title: No intelligence background: Israel names Roman Gofman as new Mossad director - Who is he?
content: Prime Minister Netanyahu has appointed Major General Roman Gofman, his military secretary, as the new director of the Mossad, succeeding David Barnea in June 2026. Gofman, a decorated officer with extensive military experience but no prior intelligence background, is seen as a close confidant of Netanyahu.

title: HSSC CET Group C result 2025 declared: Direct link to download here
content: The Haryana Staff Selection Commission has released the HSSC CET 2025 results for Group-C posts, bringing relief to over 13 lakh candidates who appeared for the July exam. Scorecards are now available on the HSSC website. With results out, the commission will next issue category-wise cut-offs, merit lists, and document verification schedules before proceeding to vacancy allocation.

title: Putin in India: ‘Defence ties to deepen despite US, EU oppn’; S-500 supply uncertain
content: India and Russia are deepening their defense ties, focusing on niche technologies and industrial cooperation. Despite global pressures, New Delhi reaffirms its strategic autonomy. Discussions included S-400 systems, Sukhoi upgrades, and BrahMos missile advancements, underscoring a commitment to bolstering India's indigenous defense capabilities and maintaining a strong partnership with Moscow.

title: Get set, no-go: You can check in any time, but you can't leave!; cancellations leave flyers stranded
content: Travelers throughout India experienced a wave of flight cancellations and lengthy delays, with IndiGo being the hardest hit. Families found themselves marooned at airports, grappling with steep rebooking fees and unclear travel arrangements. This turmoil, caused by new regulations on crew rest periods, left many bewildered and desperate for clarity amidst the operational chaos.

title: Do you need a humidifier and air purifier together for this winter's dryness and pollution
content: Dry winter air and seasonal pollution create discomfort indoors, causing dryness, breathing irritation and allergies. A humidifier restores moisture while an air purifier removes pollutants like dust and PM2.5. Using both together can improve comfort and respiratory health, especially in polluted cities or heated homes. Choose based on your environment and needs.

title: Putin in India: PM Modi gifts Russian edition of Bhagwat Gita to President; bilateral talks today
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi welcomed Russian President Vladimir Putin to India with a warm gesture, presenting him with a copy of the Bhagavad Gita in Russian. The two leaders engaged in a friendly interaction at the airport before heading to a private dinner. Putin's visit includes bilateral talks, business forums, and a tribute at Rajghat.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for today - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Bajaj Broking Research highlights Max Healthcare and Tata Power as top stock picks for December 5, 2025. The Nifty and Bank Nifty are expected to consolidate, with key support levels identified. Investors are advised to accumulate quality stocks for potential upside moves.

title: Biggest ever US travel ban in the works? More than 30 countries could be under review
content: The US is reportedly planning to significantly expand its travel ban, potentially adding over 30 countries to the existing list. Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem confirmed the expansion is underway, citing concerns over countries lacking stable governments and adequate vetting processes.

title: 'Where is Shami?': Left out of Team India — pacer answers with Man-of-the-Match in SMAT
content: Easwaran, who is also trying to strengthen his case ahead of the IPL auction, scored 58 off 37 balls. Bengal chased 166 in 15.1 overs. Abhishek Porel, representing Delhi Capitals in the IPL, scored 56 off 29 balls. The pair added 93 runs for the second wicket in 8.2 overs, which set up the chase.

title: 'Fear for life': FIR against Gurgaon BJP councillor for pressuring daughter to marry; cops get email
content: A BJP councillor and his wife are accused of holding their daughter captive and pressuring her into an arranged marriage. The daughter, Neha Kataria, emailed authorities for help, leading to her rescue from her home a day before her scheduled wedding. An FIR has been filed against the parents for wrongful confinement.

title: Russian President’s visit turns parts of city into a fortress
content: President Putin's visit to New Delhi has transformed key areas into a heavily fortified zone, mirroring G20 security measures. His custom-built Aurus Senat limousine, a "rolling bunker," was flown in for his protection. A five-layer security grid, combining Russian and Indian elite forces, ensures his safety, with snipers and anti-drone systems deployed.

title: PM Modi, Putin At Hyderabad House After Rajghat Visit, Guard Of Honour
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin is in India on a state visit aimed at bolstering bilateral and economic ties between New Delhi and Moscow.

title: Indigo Flights Disruption Live Updates: All Domestic Flights Out Of Delhi Cancelled Till Midnight Today
content: IndiGo on Friday cancelled till midnight all its domestic flights departing from the Delhi airport as the airline continues to grapple with significant operational disruptions.

title: 'My Mother Crushed My Stomach With A Stone': Tales Of Abortion In Afghanistan
content: The Taliban -- who follow a strict interpretation of Islam -- did not change the abortion laws when they returned to power in 2021.

title: "Rare Goldilocks Period": RBI Celebrates High Growth, Record Low Inflation
content: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra on Friday characterised India's current macroeconomic moment as a "rare goldilocks period", that currently marks high economic growth and exceptionally low inflation.

title: Russia's Rosatom Delivers Nuclear Fuel To Kudankulam Plant In Tamil Nadu
content: Russia's state-run nuclear corporation has said it has delivered the first consignment of nuclear fuel for initial loading of the third reactor at the Kudankulam nuclear power plant in Tamil Nadu.

title: RBI Governor Revises Inflation Outlook Downward To 2% For FY26
content: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Friday revised the inflation outlook for the current financial year, FY26, projecting CPI inflation at 2 per cent, marking a reduction of 0.6 per cent from its earlier projection.

title: "Thanks To IndiGo, Haven't Slept In 3 Days": Passengers At Delhi Airport
content: According to the latest passenger advisory, all IndiGo domestic flights departing from the Delhi airport are cancelled till midnight today.

title: IndiGo Flight Cancelled, Techie Couple Attends Own Reception Online
content: IndiGo has cancelled hundreds of flights across India this week after failing to make sufficient changes to its roster planning to accommodate new government norms.

title: Thane Man Says No To Divorce, Wife And Her Brother Kill Him In Forest
content: A woman and three others have been arrested for allegedly killing her husband, whose partially burnt body was found on a highway in Maharashtra's Thane district, police said on Friday.

title: Andhra Pradesh To Get India's First Solar Ingot-Wafer Manufacturing Unit
content: This facility will be India's first commercial-scale integrated ingot-wafer manufacturing unit, producing the essential building blocks for solar cells and modules.

title: "Not Here To Shout": Shashi Tharoor Schools Congress Over Parliament Chaos
content: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor has schooled the opposition over disruptions in parliament, putting his differences with his party colleagues out in the open yet again.

title: US Cuts Down Work Permit Validity For Refugees, Asylum Seekers To 18 Months
content: US President Donald Trump's administration on Thursday cut to 18 months from five years the period of time work permits are valid for refugees, asylum seekers and other migrants.

title: Vladimir Putin In India LIVE Updates: Russian President Receives Guard of Honour, Pays Tribute To Mahatma Gandhi
content: Putin India Visit LIVE Updates: Russian President Vladimir Putin is in India for his two-day state visit. The Russian delegation will hold discussions on cooperation in areas such as trade, economy, science, technology, and culture.

title: Boris Yeltsin: When A Russian President Visited India For The First Time
content: India and the Soviet Union shared friendly and cooperative relations during the Cold War, but the collapse of the USSR in 1991 and the emergence of a unipolar world left India in the lurch.

title: Delhi Police Issues Traffic Advisory Amid Vladimir Putin's Visit
content: Traffic restrictions and diversions are in place in several parts of the national capital, including central Delhi, on Friday in view of Russian President Vladimir Putin's visit, the Delhi Police said.

title: US Defence Secretary Hegseth Keeps Trump's Favor For Now Despite String of Missteps
content: In the high-frequency churn of President Donald Trump's first term, Defence Secretary Pete Hegseth's repeated missteps would have fuelled guessing games about his imminent firing.

title: RBI Slashes Repo Rate By 25 Basis Points Amid Rupee Slump: What It Means
content: The repo rate is the interest rate at which commercial banks borrow money from the RBI by pledging government securities.

title: Bengaluru Doctor, Second Main Accused In Andhra Transplant Racket, Arrested
content: A doctor from Bengaluru, who is named as the second main accused in a shocking organ transplant racket in Andhra Pradesh, surrendered before the court in the state's Annamayya district on Thursday night.

title: US Team Plans to Visit India Next Week for Trade Talks
content: A team of negotiators from the Trump administration led by Deputy US Trade Representative Rick Switzer plans to travel to India next week to continue talks on a trade agreement, according to a US official.

title: Panipat's "Killer Mom" Recorded Children Dancing Hours Before Drowning Them
content: The clip, which was recorded in 2023, showed her son, Shubham, and nine-year-old Ishika - child of her sister-in-law, jumping and dancing on a bed to a song.

title: Uttarakhand begins pre-revision exercise to verify voters from 2003 rolls
content: During the pre-SIR phase, voters aged 40 and above whose names appeared on the 2003 list will be verified through the Booth Level Officer (BLO) app

title: Opposition slams Lucknow mayor for her visit to slums to identify ‘illegal immigrants’
content: Describing the visit as an intimidation tactic by the Bharatiya Janata Party government in the State, opposition parties questioned the mayor’s authority to check the identity documents of people

title: Healthy collaboration and competition among States will help build a strong and diversified space industry: Dr. Vinod Kumar
content: Dr. Vinod Kumar, Director, Promotion Directorate, IN-SPACe, believes that a healthy spirit of collaboration and competition among States will accelerate innovation, and help India build a strong and diversified space industry

title: Can Karnataka retain its numero uno tag as India’s top destination for space?
content: Karnataka, which recently approved the Space Technology policy 2025-30, has many leading start-ups in the sector headquartered in its capital Bengaluru. Hemanth C.S. speaks to stakeholders  in the ecosystem on the policy and its execution

title: Salman Rushdie and his magic space | Review of The Eleventh Hour
content: In his first work of fiction after the 2022 attack, Rushdie explores art and mortality through five poignant short stories

title: From robotic surgery to radiation beams: understanding precision healing in oncology
content: The armamentarium of tools to fight cancer has evolved to become sharper, more precise and most importantly, safer. Awareness of, and understanding these tools can help patients and caregivers navigate their treatment pathways with confidence and hope

title: World Soil Day: Grassland soils, not trees, anchor India’s climate resilience
content: Grasslands play a crucial role in creating healthy soils, primarily through their deep and fibrous root systems that enhance soil structure, and promote long-term carbon storage

title: Nation’s identity is rooted in its culture, traditions, and the legacy of great personalities, says U.P. CM Yogi
content: Yogi Adityanath talked about the nation, faith, and national pride. “Whenever the country faces a crisis or a major challenge, the bravery and sacrifices of great heroes ignite new strength within us

title: Mahayuti gave financial and intellectual bankruptcy: Congress
content: Congress State party chief Harshwardhan Sapkal accuses the ruling alliance of failing farm relief, jobs, and transparency; flags irregularities in local polls and rising corruption.

title: Enduring symbol of a lasting bond between great music and fine food
content: ‘Madurai’ Mani Iyer lived in a house for 10 years in Mayiladuthurai after leaving Madras in 1939 following the evacuation during the Second World War. After returning to Madras in 1955, he sold the house to Agoram Iyer, a celebrated cook, rejecting a higher bid

title: Jawaharlal Nehru’s language of optimism and equality at the Madras Corporation
content: Aware that language was a politically sensitive issue in Tamil Nadu, the Prime Minister gave a promise in a speech in 1963 that “any idea that any one language can dominate over others or, what is called linguistic imperialism, is totally unrealistic”. He also rejected the notion that one language would hamper the growth of the other language

title: A fort in the midst of a forest was a secret training ground for cavalry and elephants
content: In the early 1700s, King Chellamuthu  Vijayaragunatha  Sethupathy was gifted 200 horses by a Muslim businessman from Thondi. He built a fort in a dense tropical thorn forest, about 70 km from Ramanathapuram. Here, Sankarapathi, one of Hyder  Ali’s commandants, trained these horses. Impressed by the tutelage, the king named the fort after him

title: The push to globalise Indian storytelling
content: India’s video gaming, comics and storytelling firms are rich in talent but lack capital and ecosystem support; a handful of creators are now trying to develop franchises and original IPs with international appeal while overcoming these challenges

title: Government stands firmly with the youth at every step: Hemant Soren
content: He addressed the candidates who had gathered to celebrate with drums and trumpets at his residence following the Jharkhand High Court’s order to release the JSSC CGL results and begin the recruitment process.

title: President’s rule would have been imposed in West Bengal had we not gone ahead with SIR says Mamata
content: Without making a direct reference to MLA  Humayun Kabir who was suspended by the Trinamool Congress earlier in the day,  Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said that “traitors take BJP’s money to stoke communal tensions” in Murshidabad

title: Ex-Manipur CM flags ‘existential crisis’ amid poppy cultivation
content: N. Biren Singh issued the warning as the Joint Tribes Council Manipur petitioned Prime Minister Narendra Modi, seeking his attention to the impact of unchecked illegal migration on the indigenous population

title: Probe ordered into 'poisonous gas leak' from underground mines in Dhanbad; locals to shift
content: A woman allegedly died, while 12 people fell sick after “carbon monoxide” leaked from mines in different places of Kenduadih Basti, say officials

title: Parliament approves Bill to levy higher excise duty on tobacco
content: The provisions of the Bill will come into effect once the GST compensation cess, which is currently levied on tobacco, comes to an end

title: A.P. Health Minister underscores need for doctors to have service mindset
content: A.P. government is positive about providing admissions to PHC doctors through in-service quota in DNB courses, says Health Minister

title: IndiGo to introduce wide-body aircraft on Vijayawada-Hyderabad route: MP
content: The IndiGo official assures that direct services from Vijayawada to Varanasi, Ahmedabad, Pune, Kochi and Goa will be introduced after completing route mapping

title: Kalasha Jyoti procession marks 44 years of Bhavani Deeksha tradition at Kanaka Durga temple
content: The Bhavani Deeksha has been observed at the Kanaka Durga temple since 1981, following the guidance of the Kanchi Kamakoti Peethadhipatis

title: Venkaiah Naidu calls for making Telugu proficiency mandatory for govt. jobs
content: Students of 144 colleges affiliated to Krishna University participate in youth festival Krishna Tarang-2025 at Machilipatnam

title: A.P. farmers demand immediate procurement of paddy at MSP
content: Procurement staff are unable to explain moisture parameters and farmers are being directly sent to private mills where millers dictate the prices, says Tenant Farmers’ Association

title: A.P. cotton farmers demand MSP, plan protest at CCI Guntur on December 10
content: Andhra Pradesh Farmers’ Association seeks relaxation of CCI norms, procurement of produce at MSP, input subsidies and crop insurance for losses among other demands

title: BNHS to release six critically endangered vultures in Assam after 15-year conservation effort
content: Three Slender-billed and three White-rumped vultures, bred in captivity, will undergo a soft release in Kamrup and Biswanath districts of Assam in January 2026.

title: Supreme Court directs 30% reservation for women in State Bar Councils
content: Petitions point out the stark underrepresentation of women and other marginalised groups in Bar Council bodies across the country.

title: Tirupparankundram row | T.N. loses appeal, judge again orders lighting of lamp at Deepathoon
content: Justice G.R. Swaminathan directs the Subramaniya Swamy temple authorities to ensure that the lamp is lit at the Deepathoon (pillar) near a dargah

title: Kerala local body polls: Campaigning shifts to top gear in Ernakulam
content: Though the campaign buzz is slowly peaking in the urban local bodies, the situation is different in the second towns and panchayats

title: Govt blocking Leader of the Opposition meetings with foreign leaders: Rahul Gandhi
content: Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra said, “Every democracy has a protocol which should be followed. The government wants to capture everything, silence other voices, and is breaking protocols. This reflects insecurity.”

title: CPI(M) seeks probe into demolition of JJ Nagar houses in Vijayawada
content: It is unjustifiable and immoral to destroy houses built with loans, despite a Supreme Court stay order valid until December 31, says CPI(M) leader

title: Proposed power to EC to hold simultaneous polls is not excessive, Law Commission tells House panel
content: During the briefing, members said the law panel also noted that the Constitution amendment Bill did not require ratification by at least 50% of the State Assemblies to come into force

title: Duplicate voters left on Bihar rolls post SIR: petitioner
content: “The EC did not disclose the list of voters deleted from 2025 roll until forced to do so by the Supreme Court in an August 14 order,” advocate Prashant Bhushan submitted.

title: IndiGo cancels 550 flights, airports see continued turmoil
content: 250 flights cancelled across four major airports; airline officials meet Civil Aviation Minister, say flights will be curtailed from December 8; seek exemption from night flying rules till February 10

title: Madras High Court stalls release of Karthi-starrer Vaa Vaathiyar
content: Justices S.M. Subramaniam and K. Rajasekar grant the interim order following a petition filed by the Official Assignee of the High Court in case related to insolvent businessman Arjunlal Sunderdas case

title: Supreme Court declines to halt ‘illegal’ demolitions in Bareilly, asks residents to approach High Court
content: When petitioners’ counsel insisted that the authorities are “standing with bulldozers” and that further demolition is imminent, Bench agreed to grant limited interim protection

title: Visakhapatnam researchers document unique predatory behaviour of horn-eyed ghost crab
content: The sighting at Rushikonda sheds new light on a species believed to stay confined to sandy intertidal zones

title: Cannot interfere in panchayat poll process, says HC
content: Courts cannot interfere with the process of elections once the notification is issued, as per Article 243-O of the Constitution, the HC noted

title: Cowboys 'not deflated' by harder path to playoffs
content: Cowboys quarterback Dak Prescott said the team would use Thursday night's loss to the Lions, and the tougher odds to make the postseason, as "fuel" with four games to go.

title: LeBron scores 8; record double-digit streak ends
content: LeBron James had a chance to extend his record double-digit scoring streak but opted to pass the ball, setting up Rui Hachimura's winning 3-pointer at the buzzer Thursday night against the Raptors.

title: Sources: Penn St. turns focus to ISU's Campbell
content: Iowa State coach Matt Campbell has emerged as the focus of Penn State's head coaching search, sources told ESPN.

title: Maxey's 'amazing' block preserves 76ers' win

title: Cowboys WR Lamb suffers concussion, ruled out
